chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Maxwell A Decker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
- Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
- Take all medications as prescribed with no deviations.
- Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
- No Contact with the victim or the victims family.
- Defendant is not to associate with any known drug users or drug houses.

1:37 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA Christenson.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  Statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2014CF123 

3 years of Initial Confinement and 3 years of Extended Supervision

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Take all medications as prescribed with no deviations.
-Restitution of $50.00
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-No Contact with the victim or the victims family.
-Defendant is not to associate with any known drug users or drug houses.

2014CM113

-60 days county jail, concurrent to any other sentence the defendant may be serving.
-court costs

2014CM143

-60 days county jail, concurrent to any other sentence the defendant may be serving.
-court costs

2014CM36

-60 days county jail, concurrent to any other sentence the defendant may be serving.
-court costs

Court finds the defendant eligible for the CIP & SAP programs.

Court adjourned at 1:51 p.m.

of hearing held on August 4, 2015, before Hon Mark T. Slate - Circuit Court Judge, by Jill M. Bartol - Court Reporter
to Agent Bret Grant - court approves the request for extension to file the PSI.  PSI is to be filed on or before October 16, 2015.

from Agent Bret Grant - requests an extension to file the PSI.
Sentencing hearing at 11-10-2015 01:30 pm
Dodge County Jail - 10/20/2015 at 1:00 p.m. (Sentencing Hearing)
Sentencing hearing at 10-20-2015 01:30 pm

11:05 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA recites plea agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 on 2014CM143, count 1 on 2014CF123 & count 1 on 2014CM113, with the balance of the counts being dismissed and read-in.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Statement by Atty Privat regarding a case with the DPA that was revoked.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 on 2014CM143, count 1 on 2014CF123 & count 1 on 2014CM113.  Court orders the balance of the counts be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Court orders a presentence investigation report be completed and filed with the court within 60 days.  Court will set 2014CM 36 be set for P & S with the PSI sentencing on October 20, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 11:12 a.m.

Court reconvenes at 11:13 a.m.  Statement by Atty Privat regarding authorization of PSI to be used in Dodge and FDL counties.  No objection by ADA.  Court so orders.

Court adjourned at 11:14 a.m.

Statement by Atty Privat - defendant has some cases pending in Dodge County and requests another court date.  Court questions Atty Privat regarding competency.  Statement by Atty Privat - no competency issues.  Court will set for plea & sentencing on August 4, 2015 at 11:00 a.m.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for Status Hearing on February 10, 2015 at 2:00 P.M. (all cases).
